title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Kiosque of Arrows 2
            
              (Bureau B)
label: Bureau B
description:
Tolouse Low Trax plucks out obscure slow-mo zingers across time and place for a class taste of the Salon Des Amateurs style he was instrumental in shaping alongside Vladimir Ivkovic and Lena Willikens

Commanding a perfectly groggy collection for the latest Bureau B compilation, Düsseldorf’s Detlef Weinrich aka Tolouse Low Trax (and catalyst of Toresch) joins... more

label: Incienso
description:
Brooklyn-based producer and visual artist Josh Abramovici's debut album is a blunted, slo-mo throb of distant Artificial Intelligence-era pads, DJ Python-esque bass and crunchy, dubwise FX. Basically a hybrid of early Mo'Wax, DJ Olive, Higher Intelligence Agency and Amazondotcom >> another winner for Incensio.

Trip-hop is fully back eh? downstairs J's first... more

label: Offen Music
description:
Maria Rossi graces Vladimir Ivkovic’s Offen Music with a special new round of plasmic vocal incantations. This stuff works like a book of spells, we tell you.

Descending from her cloud base somewhere above Glasgow, Rossi presents her most succinct suite of tunes in ‘Seesteyttää’ after a handful of progressively tight and impressive releases with Night... more

title_full:
JOY ORBISON

              —
              still slipping vol. 1
            
              (XL Recordings)
label: XL Recordings
description:
The keenly awaited debut full length from Joy O arrives as a proper friends and family affair, packed with guest co-production and vox by Herron, James Massiah, Bathe, Léa Sen, Goya Gumbani, and many more

Twelve years since his anthemic first single ‘Hyph Mngo’, ‘still slipping vol. 1’ shapes up as a definitive long-player/mixtape with 14 choice cuts that speak... more

title_full:
Andy Mac

              —
              First & Last, Sennen
            
              (Fleetway Tapes)
label: Fleetway Tapes
description:
A Colourful Storm’s Fleetway Tapes sublabel follow up that crushing ’Time Is Away’ tape with this super satisfying curveball from Andy Mac, offering over an hour of spirited vibrations that come highly recommended if yr into Beatrice Dillon, Awkward Corners/Chris Menist, Peverelist.

A decade since Andy Mac committed his crispy debut productions to Peverelist’s... more

label: Freedom To Spend
description: Unmissable, pioneering material from Bay Area original Pamela Z, a composer and performance artist who developed an operatic and percussive looping vocal technique using echo pedals that pre-empted sounds from Grouper, Maja Ratkje, Klein and even "Medúlla"-era Björk. Expressive and still completely singular music that connects Breadwoman with Moor... more

label: Discrepant
description:
Underground Portuguese/UK nodes, Niagara and Discrepant collate the star-eyed trio’s hard-to-find early works with a particular focus on their beat-less and shimmering cosmic electronic styles.

Forming a natural meeting of mutual spirits, Niagara’s charmingly hard-to-place meld of fizzing melodies and ancient-futurist hardware whims finds an ideal... more

label: No Corner
description:
Lowkey but pivotal Bristolian duo O$VMV$M supply No Corner with their first 12”, some 6 years after their debut ‘Memoryz Ov U’ in 2015

Part of the sprawling but loose knit Young Echo collective, Amos Childs (Jabu) and Sam Barrett (Neek) have been in the shadows recently, producing for Manonmars and Rider Shafique, but ‘Weekend Saviour’ marks their sultry... more

release: Cybernetic Defiance and Orgasm: The Essential Henry Kawahara (EM Records)
title_full:
Henry Kawaha

            —
            Cybernetic Defiance and Orgasm: The Essential Henry Kawahara (EM Records)

Gombeen & Doygen

              —
              D’americana / Auto-Lies
            
              (Wah Wah Wino)
label: Wah Wah Wino
description:
Morgan Buckley and James Grünfeld’s Gombeen & Doygen duo lift up a leg and trample on a scuzzy dub-house skank for Dublin’s cultish Wah Wah Wino

Last spotted on the label’s opening gambit ‘Absolutely Wino’, the duo firm up a loping, rugged take on Berlin dub-house styles casting us back to the ‘00s styles of Deadbeat, Thomas Fehlmann, or Andreas... more

label: Efficient Space
description:
Unmissable reissue of Valya Hooi’s standout debut, an immaculately frayed conception of dubwise dream-pop from the same Aussie quarters that gave us HTRK/Jonnine, CS + Kreme, F Ingers...

Valya's first record ‘Untitled’ was originally issued by Altered States Tapes in 2019 (the same year as her song-writing credit on ‘I Don’t Seem Myself Tonight’ from... more

title_full:
Parris

              —
              Soaked In Indigo Moonlight
            
              (Can You Feel The Sun)
label: Can You Feel The Sun
description:
UK club music’s deftest yields a killer debut album of screwball pop romance, squirrely garage, slow/fast f*ckery, and patented beatdown slants, one of the year's finest.

Prized for his free metered approach to the UK dance prism, Parris has become a standard bearer for new mutations of UK Bass: a shorthand catch-all description for derivations of house... more

release: Donne Che Corrono Coi Lupi (Osare Editions)
title_full:
V​.​A.

            —
            Donne Che Corrono Coi Lupi (Osare Editions)

Teresa Winter

              —
              Motto Of The Wheel
            
              (The Death Of Rave)
label: The Death Of Rave
description:
Teresa Winter returns with a definitive new album of lush, feverish rave mutations, dream-pop and ambient noise that’s highly recommended if yr feeling Cosey, A.R. Kane, A Guy Called Gerald, Laila Sakini.

'Motto Of The Wheel’ is a supernaturally compelling, definitive opus providing a life-giving bounty of warped ‘90s rave mutations, dream-pop and ambient... more

title_full:
Sir E.U + Tooth Choir

              —
              Bop 3
            
              (Future Times Records)
label: Future Times Records
description: Labyrinthine and constantly challenging, "Bop 3" questions the usefulness of genre by slathering Sir E.U's complex vocal dexterity with equally genre-busting production from Tooth Choir. Seriously where else are you gonna hear acid-house gospel rap ('Untitled (2 Much)'), overdriven post-punk ('How Much Longer') and 20 minutes of Sprinkles-esque freeform... more
